A mutex that protects access to Python objects, preventing multiple threads from executing Python bytecodes at once
A memory management tool that automatically deletes unused variables
A security feature that prevents unauthorized code execution

options: __getattr__ is called for every attribute access, while __getattribute__ is only called if the attribute isn't found

text: How does a generator function differ from a regular function in Python memory management?
options: It returns a list of all values at once
It creates a new thread for execution

text: Which mechanism does R use for 'copy-on-modify' behavior?
